00033 namespace com { namespace xuggle { namespace ferry {
00048   class VS_API_FERRY Logger
00049   {
00050   public:
00054     typedef enum Level
00055     {
00056       LEVEL_ERROR=0,
00057       LEVEL_WARN=1,
00058       LEVEL_INFO=2,
00059       LEVEL_DEBUG=3,
00060       LEVEL_TRACE=4
00061     } Level;
00062 
00070     static Logger* getLogger(const char *aLoggerName);
00071 
00082     static Logger* getStaticLogger(const char *aLoggerName);
00083 
00095     bool log(const char* filename, int lineNo, Level level, const char *format, ...);
00096 #ifndef SWIG // SWIG shouldn't know about this.
00097     bool logVA(const char* filename, int lineNo, Level level, const char *format, va_list ap);
00098 #endif // SWIG
00099     /*
00100      * A series of convenience methods that model the slf4j
00101      * API
00102      */
00103     bool error(const char* filename, int lineNo,const char* format, ...);
00104     bool warn(const char* filename, int lineNo, const char* format, ...);
00105     bool info(const char* filename, int lineNo, const char* format, ...);
00106     bool debug(const char* filename, int lineNo, const char* format, ...);
00107     bool trace(const char* filename, int lineNo, const char* format, ...);
00108 
00109 
00110     bool isLogging(Level level);
00111     void setIsLogging(Level level, bool value);
00112     static bool isGlobalLogging(Level level);
00113     static void setGlobalIsLogging(Level level, bool value);
00114     const char * getName();
00115 
00116     virtual ~Logger();
00117 
00118   protected:
00119     Logger(const char* loggerName, jobject aJavaLogger);
00120   private:
00121     static bool init();
00122     static void initJavaBindings(JavaVM* vm, void* closure);
00123     static bool mInitialized;
00124     static void shutdownJavaBindings(JavaVM* vm, void* closure);
00125     // This is the maximum size of a log message.  If
00126     // needed, someone should eventually reimplement this with
00127     // the right buffer-growth stuff, and with thread-safe
00128     // semantics, but for now, this implementation just allocates
00129     // this buffer on the stack before handing off to Java/stdio.
00130     static const int cMaxLogMessageLength=4096;
00131     static const int cMaxLoggerNameLength=255;
00132     char mLoggerName[cMaxLoggerNameLength+1];
00133     bool mIsLogging[5];
00134 
00135     bool doLog(Level level, const char*msg);
00136     bool doNativeLog(Level level, const char *msg);
00137     bool doJavaLog(Level level, const char* msg);
00138 
00139     jobject mJavaLogger;
00140     static jclass mClass;
00141     static jmethodID mGetLoggerMethod;
00142     static jmethodID mLogMethod;
00143 
00144     static Mutex *mClassMutex;
00145     static bool mGlobalIsLogging[5];
00146   };

00149 /*
00150  * Now, for the wackly logging convenience macros
00151  */
00152 #ifndef VS_CPP_PACKAGE
00153 #define VS_CPP_PACKAGE native.__FILE
00154 #endif // ! VS_CPP_PACKAGE
00155 
00156 /*
00157  * To use this, put the following at the top of your CPP file:
00158  *
00159  * <code>
00160  *    VS_LOG_SETUP(VS_CPP_PACKAGE);
00161  * </code>
00162  *
00163  * Then, you can use any of these macros anywhere in the file to
00164  * log:
00165  *
00166  * <code>
00167  *      VS_LOG_ERROR("an example: %s", aStringVariable);
00168  * </code>
00169  *
00170  * IMPORTANT NOTE: These macros use "Variadic Macros" which are
00171  * not guaranteed to work on all compilers, but work on our
00172  * set of GCC 4.x, Visual Studio 2005+.
00173  * See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variadic_macro
00174  *
00175  */
00176 #define VS_TOSTRING( S ) #S
00177 
00178 #define VS_LOG_SETUP( LOGGERNAME ) \
00179   static com::xuggle::ferry::Logger* vs_logger_static_context( \
00180   com::xuggle::ferry::Logger::getStaticLogger( VS_TOSTRING( LOGGERNAME ) ) )
00181 
00182 #define VS_LOG_ERROR(...) \
00183   (void) vs_logger_static_context->error(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
00184 
00185 #define VS_LOG_WARN(...) \
00186   (void) vs_logger_static_context->warn(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
00187 
00188 #define VS_LOG_INFO(...) \
00189   (void) vs_logger_static_context->info(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
00190 
00191 #define VS_LOG_DEBUG(...) \
00192   (void) vs_logger_static_context->debug(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
00193 
00194 #define VS_LOG_TRACE(...) \
00195   (void) vs_logger_static_context->trace(__FILE__, __LINE__, __VA_ARGS__)
00196 
00197 #ifdef VS_DEBUG
00198 #define VS_ASSERT( expr , msg ) \
00199   do { \
00200     if ( ! ( expr ) ) {\
00201       VS_LOG_ERROR("!!!ASSERTION FAILED!!! \"" VS_TOSTRING (expr) "\" with message \"%s\"", msg); \
00202     } \
00203     assert(expr); \
00204   } while (0)
00205 #else
00206 // don't insert anything if we're not debugging
00207 #define VS_ASSERT( expr, msg ) (void) vs_logger_static_context;
00208 #endif // VS_DEBUG
00209 
00210 /*
00211  *  Now, some logic to turn logging off on the compile line if needed.
00212  *
00213  * You can define the following on the compiler command line.  The
00214  * most conservative definition will win.
00215  *
00216  * VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_NONE : no log messages get compiled in.
00217  * VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_ERROR : only ERROR messages get compiled in.
00218  * VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_WARN : only ERROR and WARN messages get compiled in.
00219  * VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_INFO : ERROR, WARN and INFO messages get compiled in.
00220  * VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_DEBUG: ERROR, WARN, INFO and Debug messages get compiled in.
00221  * VS_LOG_LEVLEVELS_ALL: All debug messages get compiled in.
00222  * none of these terms on CC line: All debug messages get compiled in.
00223  */
00224 #ifdef VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_NONE
00225 #undef VS_LOG_ERROR
00226 #undef VS_LOG_WARN
00227 #undef VS_LOG_INFO
00228 #undef VS_LOG_DEBUG
00229 #undef VS_LOG_TRACE
00230 #define VS_LOG_ERROR(...) do {} while(0)
00231 #define VS_LOG_WARN(...) do {} while(0)
00232 #define VS_LOG_INFO(...) do {} while(0)
00233 #define VS_LOG_DEBUG(...) do {} while(0)
00234 #define VS_LOG_TRACE(...) do {} while(0)
00235 #else
00236 #ifdef VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_ERROR
00237 #undef VS_LOG_WARN
00238 #undef VS_LOG_INFO
00239 #undef VS_LOG_DEBUG
00240 #undef VS_LOG_TRACE
00241 #define VS_LOG_WARN(...) do {} while(0)
00242 #define VS_LOG_INFO(...) do {} while(0)
00243 #define VS_LOG_DEBUG(...) do {} while(0)
00244 #define VS_LOG_TRACE(...) do {} while(0)
00245 #else
00246 #ifdef VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_WARN
00247 #undef VS_LOG_INFO
00248 #undef VS_LOG_DEBUG
00249 #undef VS_LOG_TRACE
00250 #define VS_LOG_INFO(...) do {} while(0)
00251 #define VS_LOG_DEBUG(...) do {} while(0)
00252 #define VS_LOG_TRACE(...) do {} while(0)
00253 #else
00254 #ifdef VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_INFO
00255 #undef VS_LOG_DEBUG
00256 #undef VS_LOG_TRACE
00257 #define VS_LOG_DEBUG(...) do {} while(0)
00258 #define VS_LOG_TRACE(...) do {} while(0)
00259 #else
00260 #ifdef VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_DEBUG
00261 #undef VS_LOG_TRACE
00262 #define VS_LOG_TRACE(...) do {} while(0)
00263 #else
00264 #ifdef VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_ALL
00265 #else
00266 #ifndef VS_DEBUG
00267 #undef VS_LOG_TRACE
00268 #define VS_LOG_TRACE(...) do {} while(0)
00269 #endif // ! VS_DEBUG
00270 #endif // VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_ALL
00271 #endif // VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_DEBUG
00272 #endif // VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_INFO
00273 #endif // VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_WARN
00274 #endif // VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_ERROR
00275 #endif // VS_LOG_LOGLEVELS_NONE
00276 
00277 #endif /*LOGGER_H_*/
